articles.title: AI screening for opioid use disorder associated with fewer hospital readmissions
articles.author: NIH
articles.summary: NIH-supported clinical trial shows AI tool as useful tool in AI research. It is funded by the National Institute for Health and Human Development (NIH). It is based on a study of an AI tool developed by the NIH. It's called AI tool.

articles.title: Welcome to the age of Otaku
articles.author: Louis Elton
articles.summary: ChatGPT-4o was shut down last Thursday because of Ghiblification. Ghibli anime fans are transforming themselves into anime characters inspired by the Studio Ghibla. The rise of this style of consumption is shaped by two macro shifts: one cultural, the other technological. The first is the mainstreaming of a postmodernic that prizes fiction over fact and vibes over shared mythologies. The second is the potent concoction of next generation multimodal AI and their capacity to create custom alternative realities.

articles.title: You can't use this awesome new Gemini Live AI video feature unless you pay
articles.summary: Gemini Premium Plan costs $19.99 a month. It gives you access to Gemini's best models, upgraded limits, and other perks like increased Google Drive storage space. For now, Gemini Live screen sharing and video capture won't work on the Gemini web app, but it could change in the future.

articles.title: Opinion: No, climate change is not a hoax
articles.summary: There is a high risk of severe storms in Chattanooga, and schools announced closings for Monday. There were 60 tornadoes in Chattanooga a few weekends ago and 40 deaths. Agreement on climate change is growing. EPA is undoing 31 environmental regulations. EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin wrote in the Wall Street Journal that the EPA is driving a dagger through the heart of climate-change religion. Religious leaders and community organizations must come together to protect the planet.

articles.title: Quantum Computing Inc. (QUBT) Lead Plaintiff Deadline is Quickly Approaching – Contact Robbins ...
articles.author: Robbins LLP
articles.summary: A class action was filed on behalf of all stockholders of Quantum Computing Inc. (NASDAQ: QUBT) between March 30, 2020 and January 15, 2025. Quantum Computing purportedly uses nonlinear quantum optics to deliver quantum products for high-performance computing applications.

articles.title: Carolina Beach startup looks to revolutionize auto tech training with virtual reality
articles.author: Nate Mauldin
articles.summary: Robin Cowie is the founder and CEO of Skillmaker.ai, a company that uses virtual and augmented reality to train auto technicians. NAPA Autoparts will use the technology to train their technicians. The software will launch at the NAPa NOW convention in Las Vegas later this month. It will become available to the general public in March of next year.

articles.title: The Definition of Stargate
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Stargate is a groundbreaking artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure project announced on January 21, 2025, by President Donald Trump. It is a joint venture among technology companies, including OpenAI, Oracle, and SoftBank, with the goal of advancing AI capabilities and securing American leadership in the field. The project aims to invest up to $500 billion over the next four years, focusing on building state-of-the-art data centers and energy infrastructure across the United States. The initiative is expected to create over 100,000 jobs.

articles.title: GPT 4.5 achieves 73% Turing Test success, blurring human-AI lines
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: A new study shows that GPT‑4.5, OpenAI's latest large language model, and Meta's Llama‑3.1‑405B succeeded in a three-party Turing Test under the right conditions. The results rekindle the long-running debate on whether the Turing Test truly measures intelligence or merely our susceptibility to clever language models.

articles.title: AI lie detector: How HallOumi's open-source approach to hallucination could unlock enterprise AI adoption
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: HallOumi is an open-source claim verification model designed to solve the accuracy problem through a novel approach to hallucination detection. It analyzes AI-generated content on a sentence-by-sentence basis. The system accepts both a source document and an AI response and determines whether the source material supports each claim in the response.

articles.title: Google Shakes Up Gemini AI Leadership
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Sissie Hsiao has been replaced as the head of Gemini, Google's AI chatbot, by Josh Woodward, the current head of Google Labs. Gemini struggles to gain ground against OpenAI's ChatGPT, which currently dominates the U.S. market. The rise of AI chatbots presents a new challenge for Google.

articles.title: Navy expands use of AI for target spotting, tracking
articles.author: Defense One
articles.summary: Next year, two U.S. warships are slated to get a prototype AI-powered system designed to filter their sensor data for potential targets and predict their behavior. The system works in a way that the Navy is comfortable with on Navy platforms and systems.

articles.title: What is 'xAI'?
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: xAI is an artificial intelligence company founded by Elon Musk in 2023. Its primary product line is built around its flagship AI model called Grok, a large language model (LLM) designed to engage users in a conversational format. The most recent version, Grok-2, was released in 2024 with reasoning capabilities, making it competitive with models like GPT-4o and Google's Gemini. In November 2024, the company raised an additional $5 billion at a valuation estimated at $50 billion.

articles.title: The Definition of Voice recognition
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Voice recognition is a technology that enables machines and software systems to identify, process, and respond to human speech. It is widely used in various applications, from virtual assistants to healthcare and accessibility tools. Voice recognition technology can be integrated into a wide range of devices, from smartphones to wearables to smart home gadgets. However, it still faces challenges, such as accuracy issues, privacy concerns, and understanding of context.

articles.title: Voice Recognition
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Voice recognition is a technology that allows machines and software systems to identify, process, and respond to human speech. It is widely used in various applications, from virtual assistants to healthcare and accessibility tools. Its benefits include increased convenience, increased productivity and increased accessibility for individuals and businesses. However, despite its advancements, voice recognition still faces challenges, such as accuracy and privacy issues.

articles.title: Unstructured Data
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Unstructured data is data that does not have a predefined data model or organized format. It is more challenging to store, process, and analyze than structured data. It's abundant in today's digital world, especially with the growth of social media, multimedia content, and IoT devices. It can't be easily queried using traditional database systems, so AI and machine learning models are frequently used to analyze and interpret this type of data.

articles.title: Turing Test
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Turing Test is a concept introduced by British mathematician Alan Turing in his seminal 1950 paper, 'Computing Machinery and Intelligence'. The test aims to determine whether a machine can exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from that of a human. It has become a recognized benchmark in the fields of artificial intelligence (AI) and cognitive science.

articles.title: The Definition of Transfer learning
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Transfer learning is a machine learning technique that allows a model trained on one task to be repurposed or fine-tuned for a related task. It has become increasingly popular in fields such as natural language processing, computer vision, and speech recognition. It reduces the amount of data and computational resources needed. It also accelerates the development of various AI systems.

articles.title: Transfer Learning
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Transfer learning is a machine learning technique that allows a model trained on one task to be repurposed or fine-tuned for a related task. It has become increasingly popular in fields such as natural language processing, computer vision, and speech recognition. It reduces the amount of data and computational resources needed and accelerates the development of AI systems.

articles.title: Training Data
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Training data is the dataset used to teach machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) models. It provides the foundation for the learning process, allowing AI systems to recognize patterns, make predictions, or perform tasks without being explicitly programmed for each step. The quality, quantity, and diversity of training data are crucial for the accuracy and generalization of AI models.

articles.title: TPU
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are a type of specialized hardware accelerator designed by Google specifically for machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) workloads. TPUs are used in various AI and machine learning applications, particularly in tasks that involve large-scale computation and require high efficiency in terms of both speed and power consumption. They work well with TensorFlow, Google's open-source machine learning library, but also support other machine learning frameworks.

articles.title: The Definition of Token
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: The process of tokenization is crucial in AI, as it breaks down text into smaller parts to make it easier for models to understand and process. Some models use subword tokens to handle rare or unknown words more effectively, while others use special tokens for specific purposes.

articles.title: Token
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: A token is a unit of text that is processed as a fundamental piece of information. It can represent words, subwords, characters, or punctuation marks depending on the AI model's design and the tokenization method used. The process of tokenization is crucial in AI as it breaks down text into smaller parts, making it easier for models to understand and process.

articles.title: Stargate
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Stargate is a groundbreaking artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure project announced on January 21, 2025, by President Donald Trump. It is a joint venture between OpenAI, Oracle, and SoftBank. The project aims to invest up to $500 billion over the next four years in data centers and energy infrastructure across the United States. It's a response to the growing competition in AI development, particularly from China.

articles.title: The Definition of Stable Diffusion
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Stable Diffusion is an advanced artificial intelligence (AI) model designed for generating images from text prompts. It is a type of generative AI that leverages deep learning techniques to create high-quality, detailed images based on user input. It has a wide range of applications across industries and creative domains.

articles.title: The Definition of Siri
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Siri is a virtual assistant integrated into Apple devices that uses voice recognition and natural language processing to perform tasks, answer questions, and offer recommendations based on user commands. It was launched in 2010 as a standalone app and became a mainstream virtual assistant in 2011 with the release of the iPhone 4S. It works on all Apple devices, including iPhones, iPads, Apple Watches and MacBooks.

articles.title: Siri
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Siri is a virtual assistant integrated into Apple devices that uses voice recognition and natural language processing to perform tasks, answer questions, and offer recommendations based on user commands. It was launched in 2010 as a standalone app and in 2011 with the release of the iPhone 4S. It works on all Apple devices, including iPhones, iPads, Apple Watches, and MacBooks.

articles.title: The Definition of Singularity
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: The singularity is a theoretical point in the future when artificial intelligence surpasses human intelligence. It's a time when machines would be able to improve themselves without human intervention. It would trigger an era of exponential technological growth. There are concerns about the loss of human control over AI systems. Governments and organizations could restrict the development of AI.

articles.title: Singularity
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: The singularity is a point in the future when artificial intelligence surpasses human intelligence. It's a point when machines will be able to improve themselves without human intervention. It would trigger an era of exponential technological growth. There are risks associated with the singularity, such as loss of control over AI systems and economic disruption. Global collaboration is needed to manage the risks.

articles.title: The Definition of Sentiment analysis
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Sentiment analysis is a branch of Natural Language Processing (NLP). It's used to analyze social media posts, reviews, customer feedback, and other textual data to gauge public sentiment or the emotional reactions to a product, service, or topic. Businesses use sentiment analysis to assess customer reviews, emails, or chat conversations. Politicians and researchers use it to understand public opinion on policies, candidates, or current events.

articles.title: Sentiment Analysis
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Sentiment analysis is a branch of Natural Language Processing (NLP). It is used to analyze social media posts, reviews, customer feedback, and other textual data to gauge public sentiment or the emotional reactions to a product, service, or topic. Businesses use sentiment analysis to assess customer reviews, emails, or chat conversations. Politicians use it to study public opinion on policies, candidates, or current events.

articles.title: ScaleAI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Scale AI is a San Francisco-based company that provides data labeling and annotation solutions for AI. Its services are foundational for applications ranging from autonomous vehicles to natural language processing and beyond. Since its founding, the company has raised over $1.6 billion in funding, achieving a valuation of $13.8 billion in its most recent round.

articles.title: The Definition of Safe Superintelligence
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Safe Superintelligence Inc. was founded in June 2024 by Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Gross and Daniel Levy. The company's principal investors include Andreesen Horowitz, Sequoia Capital, DST Global, SV Angel, and NFDG. It raised $1 billion in September 2024 at a valuation estimated to be $5 billion, and $2 billion in March 2025 at $30 billion.

articles.title: Safe Superintelligence
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Safe Superintelligence Inc. was founded in June 2024 by Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Gross and Daniel Levy. The company's principal investors include Andreesen Horowitz, Sequoia Capital, DST Global, SV Angel, and NFDG. It raised $1 billion in September 2024, at a valuation estimated to be $5 billion. In March 2025, the company raised $2 billion at $30 billion. It has offices in Palo Alto and Tel Aviv.

articles.title: Robotics
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Robotics is a multidisciplinary field that combines engineering, computer science, and artificial intelligence to design, build, and operate robots. Robots are becoming integral to various sectors of modern life, from industrial automation to healthcare, military applications, and even space exploration. AI plays a crucial role in advancing the capabilities of robotics.

articles.title: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Retrieval-Augmented generation (RAG) is an advanced AI technique combining language generation and real-time information retrieval. It's useful in fields like customer service, research, and dynamic content creation where precision and current data are essential. RAG provides users with information that is more current and accurate than standard language models. It also reduces the risk of AI 'hallucinations' where the model generates plausible but incorrect or fabricated information.

articles.title: Reinforcement Learning
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Reinforcement Learning (RL) is a type of machine learning where a model learns to make decisions by interacting with an environment. RL is widely used in fields such as robotics, game playing, and autonomous systems, where dynamic decision-making is essential. RL problems are often framed using MDPs, which provide a framework for modeling the agent-environment interaction.

articles.title: Quantum Computing
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Quantum computing is a revolutionary form of computing that uses qubits. It uses the principles of quantum mechanics to perform calculations that would be impossible for classical computers. It has potential to transform fields such as cryptography, chemistry, material science, optimization and artificial intelligence. However, it is still in its early stages and practical applications are still far from being realized.

articles.title: Prompt (AI Prompt)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Prompts are crucial in shaping the behavior of AI models as they determine the quality and relevance of the output generated. The better and more precise the prompt, the more accurate and useful the AI's response will be. The versatility of prompts allows users to tailor AI systems for diverse applications.

articles.title: Predictive Analytics
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Predictive analytics is a branch of advanced analytics that uses historical data, statistical algorithms, and machine learning techniques to predict future outcomes. It can be applied in various fields to foresee trends, anticipate customer behavior, manage risks, and enhance operational efficiency. It is a powerful tool for forecasting future events by analyzing historical data.

articles.title: Pattern Recognition
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In AI, pattern recognition is the ability of a machine or algorithm to identify and classify patterns from data. It is used in security systems, mobile phone authentication, and social media platforms. It also plays a crucial role in converting spoken language into text. It can improve decision-making in industries like healthcare, finance, and manufacturing. It's useful for applications like fraud detection and text classification.

articles.title: Parameter
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), a 'parameter' is a variable that is learned by a model during the training process. The parameters play a critical role in shaping the model's ability to make accurate predictions or decisions based on input data.

articles.title: Overfitting
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Overfitting is a problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) where a model performs well on training data but poorly on new, unseen data. Overfitting can be caused by having too many parameters, excessive training time, or a lack of regularization techniques to constrain the model's learning. The biggest consequence of overfitting is inability to generalize.

articles.title: OpenAI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: OpenAI is a San Francisco-based artificial intelligence research organization dedicated to creating and advancing AI technologies in a safe and ethical manner. It was established by prominent tech entrepreneurs and researchers, including Elon Musk, Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, John Schulman, and Wojciech Zaremba in December 2015. Elon Musk provided initial funding to the tune of $1 billion, with subsequent rounds of investment coming from major industry players. Microsoft has invested around $13 billion in OpenAI. Microsoft became the exclusive cloud provider for OpenAI's research, products, and services.

articles.title: Noise in AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Noise in artificial intelligence (AI) can interfere with the learning process of AI models, reducing their accuracy and effectiveness. Noise can take many forms, including inaccurate labels in training datasets, random fluctuations in data, or inconsistencies in input signals. Noise negatively impacts AI models in several ways depending on the severity and nature of the noise.

articles.title: Neural Networks
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Neural networks are a key technology in artificial intelligence (AI) that are inspired by the human brain's structure and functioning. They consist of interconnected layers of nodes, called 'neurons,' that work together to process and interpret data. They are used in image recognition, natural language processing, and autonomous systems.

articles.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a branch of artificial intelligence (AI) that focuses on the interaction between computers and humans through language. NLP helps machines understand, interpret and respond to human language in a meaningful and useful way. It automates tasks like document classification, translation, and customer service. Google is a leading player in the NLP space with products like Google Assistant, Google Translate, and BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers). Microsoft offers various NLP services through its Azure Cognitive Services platform.

articles.title: Natural Language Generation (NLG)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Natural Language Generation (NLG) uses artificial intelligence to produce human-like text based on structured or unstructured data. NLG is used to create narratives from numerical data, automate report generation, and even generate personalized content. It is playing a significant role in industries that need to automate repetitive writing tasks or generate large-scale content from data.

articles.title: Multimodal AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Multimodal AI is a type of artificial intelligence that can integrate and process data from multiple sources. It is transforming industries ranging from healthcare and education to entertainment and customer service. It's already being used in various industries and applications such as self-driving cars, virtual assistants, e-commerce recommendations, and social media content moderation.

articles.title: Machine Learning
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence (AI) that allows computers to learn from data and improve their performance on tasks without being programmed. Machine learning is used in a wide range of real-world applications across various industries, such as image recognition, natural language processing, and predictive analytics.

articles.title: Image Recognition
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Image recognition is a technology that enables machines to identify and process images similarly to how humans do. It is a subset of computer vision and is often powered by deep learning techniques, especially neural networks, which are trained on large datasets of labeled images to improve accuracy over time. AI-based image recognition is powerful tool used in many sectors, from healthcare to retail and autonomous driving. It comes with challenges such as potential bias, privacy issues, and high data requirements.

articles.title: Heuristic in AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Heuristics play a fundamental role in AI systems, especially in areas such as optimization, decision-making, and search algorithms. Heuristics are useful in complex AI problems where exhaustive search methods would be too slow or resource-intensive. They reduce computational time and resources needed to solve AI problems.

articles.title: Guardrails
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Guardrails are mechanisms, controls, and policies that are designed to ensure artificial intelligence systems operate safely, ethically, and within established boundaries. Guardrails can take many forms, such as technical constraints embedded into the AI models, ethical frameworks, or regulatory measures that govern AI behavior and development.

articles.title: GPT-4o
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: GPT-4o is a Large Language Model (LLM) developed by OpenAI that can process text, audio, and images simultaneously. It can be used to generate written content, have text-based conversations, and understand and produce images and audio. It is suitable for a range of real-time and large-scale applications.

articles.title: GPT
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) is an advanced AI language model developed by OpenAI. GPT operates by analyzing large datasets of text and using that knowledge to predict and generate coherent sentences, paragraphs, or entire documents. It can handle a wide range of tasks across many fields, from business to entertainment, thanks to its advanced language understanding capabilities. It's versatile and can be used for various applications, such as content generation, coding assistance and translation.

articles.title: Google Gemini
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Google Gemini is an advanced AI model developed by Google to enhance its capabilities in natural language understanding and generation. It builds upon the foundation of previous models such as Google's Bard and integrates deep learning techniques to enable more sophisticated interactions, multi-modal capabilities, and better problem-solving. It can handle multiple tasks across sectors such as education, healthcare, technology, and entertainment.

articles.title: Google Assistant
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Google Assistant is a voice-activated virtual assistant powered by artificial intelligence (AI) developed by Google. It is available on Android devices, smartphones, smart speakers, smart displays, and even in cars via Android Auto. It works by responding to a wake phrase, commonly 'Hey Google' or 'OK Google'. It can interact with other Google services like Google Search, Gmail, Google Calendar, and YouTube.

articles.title: Generative AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Generative AI is a class of artificial intelligence models designed to generate new content. Generative AI has revolutionized fields like natural language processing, art, and design. It reduces the costs associated with manual content creation, enabling companies and individuals to generate high-quality outputs quickly and at scale. It can also be misused to create fake information.

articles.title: Entity Extraction
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: The most common form of entity extraction involves identifying named entities such as people, organizations, dates, and locations from unstructured text. It is used in various industries to automate data analysis, enhance customer service, or process information quickly. It enhances efficiency in many industries by automating data processing tasks and improving information retrieval. It also comes with limitations like potential ambiguity, accuracy issues, and the need for frequent updates.

articles.title: Emergent Behavior
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Emergent behavior in AI refers to complex actions, patterns, or capabilities that arise from the interaction of simpler rules or components within an AI system. In AI, this phenomenon often occurs in large systems, such as neural networks, where individual units follow simple rules, but their collective operation can lead to highly advanced behaviors. Emergent behaviors in AI are both a powerful and complex phenomenon, providing adaptability, scalability, and innovation. They also pose challenges, particularly when it comes to control, safety, and ethics.

articles.title: Tech on Deck: The use of AI technology in U.S. Navy
articles.author: Madison Pearman
articles.summary: Admiral Daryl Caudle is the Commander of U.S. Fleet Forces Command. He organizes three-plus-three bins of tools, ranging from facial recognition to generative artificial intelligence. AI is currently helping with tasks ranging from personnel readiness to war fighting scenarios. It's also impacting the every day lives of sailors.

articles.title: Deep Learning
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Deep learning is a branch of artificial intelligence (AI). It involves training artificial neural networks to learn and make decisions from large amounts of data. It can be applied across diverse fields, including healthcare, finance, entertainment, and autonomous systems. It's used in image recognition, speech recognition, self-driving cars and medical diagnostics.

articles.title: Datasets
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: A dataset is a structured collection of data that is used for analysis, research, and training of models in fields such as artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), statistics, and data science. In AI, datasets play a foundational role because they provide the raw information that models learn from. Datasets come in various forms depending on the nature of the data being collected and the field of application.

articles.title: Data Science
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Data science is an interdisciplinary field that focuses on extracting meaningful insights and knowledge from structured and unstructured data. It combines techniques from statistics, computer science, and domain-specific knowledge to analyze, interpret, and visualize data. Data science is a powerful tool for extracting insights and making data-driven decisions across a wide range of industries. However, data science also faces limitations such as privacy concerns, data quality issues and the complexity of implementation.

articles.title: Data Center
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Data centers play a pivotal role in AI by providing the infrastructure needed to train and deploy complex models. Data centers are the backbone of modern AI, providing the computational power and storage needed to support intensive data processing and model training. They also offer scalability, speed, and reliability, but they come with challenges like high costs, energy consumption, and latency concerns.

articles.title: DALL-E
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: DALL-E is an artificial intelligence model developed by OpenAI that generates images from textual descriptions. The model is based on OpenAI's GPT architecture adapted for image generation and it uses a model to understand textual prompts and produce corresponding images. The updates to the model include improved resolution, more photorealistic images and better handling of complex objects. Inpainting allows users to edit specific parts of an image using text prompts.

articles.title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: A Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is an advanced artificial intelligence technology that processes and analyzes visual information. CNNs excel in image classification, categorization, facial recognition and analysis, optical character recognition, medical imaging diagnostics, object detection and tracking, and many other applications.

articles.title: Computer Vision
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Computer vision is a field of artificial intelligence (AI) and computer science that focuses on enabling machines to interpret and understand visual information from the world just like humans. Through computer vision, computers can recognize patterns, make decisions based on visual inputs, and even take actions in response to the data they process. Examples of Computer Vision Applications include self-driving cars, facial recognition, medical imaging, and automated check-out systems.

articles.title: Claude AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Claude AI is an advanced conversational artificial intelligence developed by Anthropic. It's designed to provide natural, engaging and helpful conversations catering to various tasks like answering questions, providing summaries, and generating human-like text. Anthropic has developed the model with strict ethical standards to ensure that it can be used safely in sensitive contexts. Claude AI is available in both free and paid versions.

articles.title: ChatGPT
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-driven tool that uses natural language processing to understand and respond to user queries. It was developed by OpenAI, based on the Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) architecture. GPT-4.5 is the company's most advanced AI chat model to date, emphasizing enhanced emotional intelligence, user interaction, and improved accuracy. It is available to ChatGPT Pro users at a subscription price of $200 per month.

articles.title: Chatbot
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: A chatbot is a software designed to simulate human conversation through text or voice interactions. It can be embedded in websites, mobile apps, messaging platforms, or even physical devices like smart speakers. Chatbots are classified into two main types: rule-based and AI-driven.

articles.title: Black Box
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In artificial intelligence (AI), the term 'black box' refers to an AI system or model where the internal workings are not easily understandable or transparent to humans. Black box AI can be used in high-stakes domains like healthcare, finance, criminal justice, or autonomous driving. It has many advantages, such as high performance, scalability, efficiency, and performance. It also has many limitations, such that it's difficult to trust the system fully.

articles.title: Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro could be the most important AI model so far this year
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: Gemini 2.5 Pro Experimental AI model from Google is a contender for the world's best model right now. It is a'reasoning' model, which uses a mix of training data and real-time reasoning performed in response to the user prompt or question. It scored well on a new benchmark test called Fiction.liveBench, which tests a model's ability to comprehend context information.

articles.title: Autonomous AI
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Autonomous AI is the ability of a system or machine to perform tasks and make decisions without direct human intervention. It is commonly used in industries like transportation, robotics, manufacturing, and defense. It offers many benefits, such as increased efficiency, cost savings, and improved safety. It also presents many risks, including job displacement, ethical challenges, and potential security vulnerabilities.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is used across a wide range of industries to improve efficiency, drive innovation, and solve complex problems. AI is transforming the healthcare industry by improving diagnostic accuracy, predicting disease outbreaks, and aiding in the development of personalized medicine. In finance, AI algorithms can analyze vast amounts of data to detect fraudulent activities in real time. In the entertainment industry, AI is used for content recommendation, video game development, and even content creation. In manufacturing, AI-powered robots can perform repetitive assembly line tasks. In software development, AI helps optimize code performance, enhance security, and improve code quality.

articles.title: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) is a theoretical form of artificial intelligence that can understand, learn, and apply knowledge just like a human being. AGI would be capable of performing any intellectual task that a human can, such as reasoning, problem-solving, learning, and adapting to new challenges. It is the ultimate goal of AI development, where machines can think, reason, and adapt as humans do.

articles.title: Apple Intelligence
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Apple's AI-driven system is designed to create a more personalized, intuitive, and efficient user experience. It works across Apple's ecosystem of devices, creating a unified experience. Apple processes most AI-related computations on the device itself, ensuring that personal data remains secure and is not stored in the cloud.

articles.title: API (Application Programming Interface)
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: APIs (Application Programming Interface) are a set of protocols and tools for building software. They allow different software systems to communicate and interact with each other by defining the methods and data formats that systems should use. They are also central to the functioning of cloud computing, where they help to integrate and connect various services and applications.

articles.title: Algorithm
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In computer science, algorithms provide a method for processing data and performing computations in a structured manner. Algorithms can vary in complexity from simple operations like adding two numbers to sophisticated methods for recognizing faces in images or predicting trends in financial markets. AI algorithms are central to many modern technologies, from voice assistants to self-driving cars.

articles.title: AI Hallucinations
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Hallucinations are when an artificial intelligence (AI) system produces information or content that is fabricated or inaccurate. They can take the form of incorrect facts, made-up citations, or nonsensical reasoning. In image generation models, hallucinations often result in visuals that are either incorrect or unrealistic.

articles.title: AI Complete
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In artificial intelligence (AI), the term 'AI-Complete' refers to the most difficult problems in AI. These problems require reasoning, problem-solving, and adaptability similar to that of a human brain. The term originated in the 1980s as a way to highlight AI's biggest challenges. Achieving AGI will require major breakthroughs beyond just better hardware.

articles.title: AI Dictionary
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: The AI Dictionary is a comprehensive dictionary of the most frequently used terms in the artificial intelligence (AI) space. Examples of terms include: algorithm, black box, chatbot, data mining, natural language processing, prompt, quantum computing, singularity, voice recognition and many more.

articles.title: AI Bias
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Biases in AI arise from the biases present in the training data or the design of the algorithms. This can have serious consequences in critical areas such as hiring, law enforcement, healthcare, and lending. Bias in AI can lead to discriminatory outcomes, exacerbating existing inequalities in society. Ensuring that AI systems are trained on diverse and representative datasets is an effective way to reduce bias.

articles.title: AI Alignment
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: As AI systems become more advanced and autonomous, there is a growing concern about their ability to behave in ways that are beneficial and safe for humanity. Alignment is the process of ensuring that artificial intelligence (AI) systems act in accordance with human values, goals, and ethical principles.

articles.title: AI Agents
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) agents are sophisticated systems designed to perform tasks autonomously or semi-autonomously with a level of decision-making capability that mimics human reasoning. They are used in industries like healthcare, finance, manufacturing, customer service, and entertainment. The core functionality of an AI agent revolves around perception, reasoning, and action. AI agents are increasingly relied upon for automating tasks, optimizing workflows, and improving decisions.

articles.title: Agentforce
articles.author: The All Business.com Team
articles.summary: In October 2024, Salesforce announced the general availability of Agentforce, an AI-driven platform designed to elevate customer service and support through autonomous, intelligent agents. The launch was personally announced by Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff in his first LinkedIn post. Agentforce is a core part of Salesforce's Customer 360 platform.

It includes: AI Dictionary, AI Agents, AI Hallucinations, Alexa, Autonomous Vehicles, Computer Vision, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Data Center, Data Mining, Data Science and Noise in AI are also included.

articles.title: Mattson Launches Chef Insights™ AI and ProtoThink™ Foodservice AI, a new Suite Of AI-Driven Tools For Foodservice Professionals
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Mattson is thrilled to introduce the world of foodservice to Chef Insights AI. The purpose-built AI model includes 40 chef personas with a resumé of decades of experience in the foodservice industry from QSR to fast casual to casual dining to non-commercial to bars.

articles.title: The Future of Creativity: How AI is Shaping Modern Art and Design
articles.author: Alexander Hamilton
articles.summary: AI-powered design tools are no longer the future, but the present. Creators are embracing AI to enhance their workflows, speed up production and explore creative horizons previously out of reach. AI is a creative assistant capable of generating thousands of variations based on your input.

articles.title: AI Horizons Summit will return as two-day event this fall
articles.author: Business Journal
articles.summary: The expanded AI showcase aims to position Pittsburgh as a prime destination for artificial intelligence companies and talent. The showcase will be open to the general public. It will be on display in Pittsburgh until the end of the year. It is expected to draw more than 100,000 people.

articles.title: SCF Advanced Technology Center Pre-College Tech Workshop
articles.author: State College
articles.summary: The State College of Florida, Manatee-Sarasota's Advanced Technology Center is offering a Pre-College Emerging Tech Workshop from 6:15 to 8 p.m. Wednesday, May 14, at SCF Bradenton, 5840 26th St. W., Building 8. Participants will network with industry experts, get a chance to ask questions during a Q&A panel and have hands-on time with AI tools. Free parking is available at the venue.

articles.title: US energy department invites AI data center development at Los Alamos and other federal lands
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Energy has identified 16 federal sites where tech companies could build data centers for artificial intelligence technology. The sites are "uniquely positioned for rapid data center construction" and have in-place energy infrastructure with the ability to fast-track permitting for new energy generation such as nuclear. New AI technology behind popular chatbots and generative AI tools requires more powerful computation to build and operate.

articles.title: Samsung TV Copilot to Replace Google Assistant
articles.author: Levin
articles.summary: Samsung is partnering with Microsoft to release Copilot as the new voice assistant on its smart TVs. This comes as a replacement for Google Assistant which had occupied this role for years. LG has also partnered with Microsoft, bringing copilot-powered AI search to its latest TVs. Google's Gemini is coming out on Google TVs later this year.

articles.title: Northeastern University joins AI-higher ed experiment
articles.author: Steph Solis
articles.summary: Northeastern University partners with Anthropic to test Claude for Higher Education. It will give premier Claude access to nearly 49,000 students, 3,500 faculty and 4,900 staff members across its 13 campuses. Anthropic also announced partnerships with the London School of Economics and Champlain College.

articles.title: Learn AI or lose your job: The new reality for federal workers
articles.author: The Washington Times
articles.summary: Federal workers are urged to develop artificial intelligence skills as the Trump administration's significant workforce reductions continue. Career counselors and government employment experts are urging federal workers to quickly develop these skills as a result of the administration's workforce reductions.      .

articles.title: AGI arrival could cause 'existential risks,' Google DeepMind says
articles.author: Jean Leon
articles.summary: According to Google DeepMind, true artificial general intelligence could arrive as early as 2030. However, the company warns that these systems could cause'severe harm' and 'permanently destroy humanity'. There are some voices in the industry that disagree with the conclusions of the report.

articles.title: Trump administration announces plans to build AI data centers on federal land
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The Trump administration identified 16 sites for the development of artificial intelligence (AI) data centers on land owned by the Department of Energy. The centers comprise rows of servers providing processing capacity for machine. The global race for AI dominance is the next Manhattan project, and with President Trump's leadership and the innovation of National Labs, the United States will win.

articles.title: Google DeepMind AI Is Now Better at Minecraft Than You — Without Being Trained on the Game
articles.author: Sherin Shibu
articles.summary: Dreamer, an AI system developed by Google's DeepMind, is able to play the popular game Minecraft without being taught how to do a difficult task. Dreamer played the game for nine days straight and learned how to collect diamonds on its own without any prior training.

articles.title: SIU's College of Arts and Media symposium focuses on integrating AI
articles.author: PETE ROSENBERY
articles.summary: CAM x AI: Innovating Creativity Symposium is from 8:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m., April 11 in Morris Library's John C. Guyon Auditorium, Hall of Presidents and Chancellors and the first-floor rotunda. Online registration and day-of registration are available.

articles.title: Robot wombs and trendy eugenics: A moral emergency
articles.author: Blazetv Staff
articles.summary: A man posted a fake photo of a robot with a baby where a woman's womb would be. MIT Technology Review reports that the first IVF babies were conceived with a sperm-injecting robot in 2023. Allie Beth Stuckey of Relatable comments is horrified by the idea of artificial wombs.

articles.title: Local college uses AI to translate the Bible
articles.author: Michael Reiner
articles.summary: Students and faculty at Grove City College are using AI to help them interpret the Bible faster. They are working with SIL Global, a faith-based nonprofit that uses machine learning to develop language solutions. The work focuses on simplifying the conversion of language characters into common Roman or Latin script.

articles.title: Google gives NotebookLM a 'Discover' button to search the web
articles.author: Ars Technica
articles.summary: Starting today, Google's NotebookLM uses AI to analyze user-provided documents. It will analyze hundreds of potential web sources starting today. Google's AI efforts so far have involved adding generative features to existing products, but Notebook LM is different.

articles.title: Centennial Hosting AI Symposium Friday
articles.author: Dino Ciliberti
articles.summary: Centennial School District is hosting an AI Symposium for schools superintendents and educational leaders on Friday. The symposium will be held from 9 a.m. to Noon at the William Tennent High School Library, 333 Centennial Rd. It will showcase how AI is reshaping teaching, learning and engagement.

articles.title: AI model can predict lightning-induced wildfires with unprecedented accuracy
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: A new artificial intelligence model developed by Israeli researchers promises to revolutionize wildfire prediction. It is based on a particular model for wildfire prediction, developed by AI experts.   It can be used to predict the future of wildfires.  It's based on an AI model with a particular algorithm.

articles.title: An image of an archeologist adventurer who wears a hat and uses a bullwhip
articles.author: Otakar G. Hubschmann
articles.summary: Studio Ghibli-zation of everything is an example of how OpenAI trains on images that are obviously someone else's work. The new update to GPT image generation has been used to convert every picture into Studio Ghibl-style images including making memes-of-memes.

articles.title: Week in Review: Launch doubleheader, Special elections and playing with AI
articles.author: Mara Bellaby
articles.summary: Randy Fine is preparing for the Cocoa Beach Triathlon. He is using artificial intelligence to help him prepare for the race. Randy Fine won his bid to be a U.S. congressman representing the Daytona Beach area. Randy won the Republican primary in a state Senate race and a state House race.

articles.title: 18 Times Elon Musk — And Elon Musk Specifically — Got Hilariously Burned By The Internet
articles.author: Andy Golder
articles.summary: The official Assassin's Creed account has posted a video from Q1 twenty-twenty-fours. It's almost as if things are supposed to work this way. Grok's AI gives him some credit in the "maximally truth-seeking" department.

articles.title: AI Horizons Summit to return to Pittsburgh in the fall, expand to two days
articles.summary: The AI Horizons Summit returns to Pittsburgh on September 11 and 12. Last year's inaugural event featured representatives from Google, OpenAI, Nvidia and Governor Josh Shapiro. The AI Strike Team is organizing the second summit. It will focus on health care, computational life sciences and defense tech and autonomy and physical AI.

articles.title: AI's $4.8 trillion future: UN warns of widening digital divide without urgent action
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is on course to become a $4.8 trillion global market by 2033, roughly the size of Germany's economy. UN report warns AI's benefits may remain in the hands of a privileged few unless urgent action is taken.

articles.title: META Is Facing Multiple AI-Related Challenges
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Joelle Pineau, head of Meta's AI Research department, is leaving the company. Meta's chatbot had the lowest traffic in March among major players in the category. The company is slated to hold its first LlamaCon on April 29. At the conference, it plans to introduce its new AI initiatives and CEO Mark Zuckerberg has teased upcoming models.

articles.title: Qualcomm becomes strategic shareholder in Qorix
articles.author: Computer Weekly
articles.summary: In January 2024, Qualcomm Technologies announced it was set to hit the accelerator on providing bedrock technology for artificial intelligence (AI)-driven and connected devices that would see a wide range of use cases such as automotive, according to the company's announcement. Qualcomm Technologies will focus on providing technology for AI-driven devices.

articles.title: An OpenAI ‘open' model shows how much the company—and AI—has changed in two years
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: OpenAI will release an open-source language model with reasoning. Fast Company's weekly newsletter, AI Decoded, breaks down the most important news in the world of AI. You can sign up to receive this newsletter every week here.   .

articles.title: AI's economic benefit massive but must be shared: UNCTAD
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is expected to reach $4.8 trillion in market value by 2033. It will shift the focus from technology to people, enabling countries to co-create a global artificial intelligence framework, UNCTAD says. UNCTad is a trade and development agency.

articles.title: Using AI reduces your critical thinking skills, Microsoft study warns
articles.author: Ben Turner
articles.summary: Microsoft and Carnegie Mellon University conducted a survey of 319 knowledge workers in business, education, arts, administration and computing. They found that those who most trusted the accuracy of AI assistants thought less critically about those tools' conclusions. The researchers will present their findings at the CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems later this month.

articles.title: OpenAI's GPT-4.5 Becomes First AI Model to Officially Pass the Turing Test
articles.author: Ryan Hansen
articles.summary: OpenAI's GPT-4.5 has passed the Turing Test, a benchmark for assessing whether a machine can exhibit human-like intelligence. The achievement has far-reaching implications for industries, ethics, and human-AI interaction. It also raises questions about how society will adapt to increasingly human like AI systems.

articles.title: New ChatGPT image tools can mimic Studio Ghibli animation style
articles.author: Shelly Brisbin
articles.summary: OpenAI's ChatGPT adds free image-creation features and makes them free to all users. In a demo, OpenAI showed off the ability to create images in the style of animator Hayao Miyazaki's Studio Ghibli. Miyazaki believes AI can be destructive and his son Gorō believes it can't replace human creativity.

articles.title: ChatGPT Plus Is Now Free For College Students
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: OpenAI is giving U.S. and Canadian college students free access to ChatGPT Plus just in time for finals. Could this move could close digital gaps and boost AI literacy? It could also help students improve their digital literacy. It's free for college students.

articles.title: India outpacing world in creativity, AI adoption: Sam Altman - INDIA New England News
articles.author: India New England News
articles.summary: India is outpacing the world in terms of AI adoption and creativity, according to OpenAI's Sam Altman. His remarks come as the company witnessed a significant surge in demand for its latest 4o image generation tool, which produces Studio Ghibli-style animations. The feature was introduced as part of a broader product update for ChatGPT last week.

articles.title: China deploys AI to monitor non-coal mines in 1st to bolster safety
articles.author: Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: China has used artificial intelligence to monitor non-coal mines for the first time to improve mining safety. The system was introduced on March 12. Engineers gathered data from the mines during the day and refined the AI algorithms in the lab at night to improve the system.

articles.title: Google is shipping Gemini models faster than its AI safety reports
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: In March, Google launched an AI reasoning model, Gemini 2.5 Pro. Three months later, it launched another AI model, Geminis 2.0 Flash. The company is trying to keep up with the rapidly evolving AI industry. Google hasn't published safety reports for its latest models yet. It's standard for frontier AI labs to do so.

articles.title: 'M3GAN 2.0' - Everything We Know So Far
articles.author: Michileen Martin
articles.summary: "M3GAN 2.0" is a sequel to the hit movie about a rogue AI. Amie Donald, Jenna Davis, Alison Williams, Violet McGraw, Brian Jordan Alvarez, Jen Van Epps, Ivanna Sakhno, Aristotle Athari, Timm Sharp, and Jemaine Clement are new to the sequel. It's released on June 27, 2025.

articles.title: Indeed CEO Chris Hyams reveals two-thirds of jobs on the platform demand skills that AI can already handle
articles.author: Emma Burleigh
articles.summary: Indeed CEO Chris Hyams says AI can perform skills for 'roughly two-thirds' of jobs on the employment platform. Some 300 million jobs could be lost or impacted by the advanced tech in the coming years. The U.S. will spend $7.6 billion on AI agents this year.

articles.title: Bearish Options Trade on AAPL Unveiled
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: A Schwab Network commentator suggests a bearish, short-term option play on Apple (AAPL). A guest on the same segment expressed bullishness about the stock market's outlook. Main Street Research's James Demmert is positive about the bull market.

articles.title: Nixxy Issues Operational Milestone Update and Highlights AI Integration Progress
articles.author: ACCESSWIRE
articles.summary: Auralink AI processed $1.2M in billed switching activity in March 2025. CallAI integration is expected to enhance efficiency through AI-based call automation and routing. The platform is officially up and running and it's processing live traffic at scale.

articles.title: Senators demand information from AI companion apps following kids' safety concerns, lawsuits
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: Two US senators are demanding that artificial intelligence companies shed light on their safety practices. This comes months after several families, including a Florida mom whose 14-year-old son died by AI chatbot, expressed concerns about the mental health and safety risks posed to young users of AI chatbots.

articles.title: This A.I. Forecast Predicts Storms Ahead
articles.summary: The A.I. Futures Project has spent the past year trying to predict what the world will look like over the next few years, as increasingly powerful artificial intelligence systems are developed. The project is led by Daniel Kokotajlo, a former OpenAI researcher who wrote detailed reports about how the race for artificial general intelligence might unfold. Ali Farhadi, the chief executive of the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, reviewed the report and said it's not grounded in scientific evidence.

articles.title: This A.I. Forecast Predicts Storms Ahead
articles.author: Kevin Roose
articles.summary: The A.I. Futures Project in Berkeley, California, has spent the past year trying to predict what the world will look like over the next few years. Daniel Kokotajlo, a former OpenAI researcher, left the company last year over his concerns that it was acting recklessly. After leaving, he teamed up with Eli Lifland, a researcher who has a track record of accurately forecasting world events, to create a fictional scenario about the future of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Nikon Z5II Camera
articles.author: Uncrate
articles.summary: Nikon Z5II is a compact, portable camera with a 24-megapixel full-frame sensor married to an EXPEED 7 image processing engine. It has 3D-tracking autofocus, AI-powered recognition of subjects like people, pets, and automobiles, and the ability to shoot up to 30 fps using the electronic shutter.

articles.title: An OpenAI ‘open' model shows how much the company—and AI—has changed in two years
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: OpenAI will release an open-weight language model with reasoning in the next few months. The company has kept its AI models proprietary and secret since 2019. Open-weight models can be more cost-effective for corporations trying to leverage AI. Runway's new video-generation system produces 'production ready' video.

articles.title: DiNapoli's audit: State agencies need more guidance on AI use to avoid risks
articles.author: Brooklyn Eagle Staff
articles.summary: Audit finds that New York state's centralized guidance and oversight of agencies' use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is inadequate and creates a risk that the technology could be used irresponsibly. The audit made seven recommendations, including strengthening AI policy, implementing training and improving governance. The DMV refuted the audit's findings, but agreed with recommendations to review its facial recognition system with ITS.

articles.title: Schwab Network Commentators Pile on AAPL Stock
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Oliver Renick and Jenny Horne are bearish on Apple (AAPL) stock. Renick suggests AAPL could get hit worse than its peers by the market's retreat. Horne thinks the tech giant's forays into AI have been disappointing so far.

articles.title: The battle against a recurrent threat
articles.author: Connie Gentry
articles.summary: Mohs micrographic surgery has up to 99% cure rate for skin cancers. Daily sunscreen use reduces skin cancer risk by 40-50%. One in five Americans will have skin cancer by age 70, and 60% of them will have a second skin cancer within 10 years of the first one.

articles.title: Microsoft CTO breaks down how he sees software developer jobs evolving in the next 5 years
articles.summary: Kevin Scott, the CTO of Microsoft, says 95% of code will be AI-generated within five years. He doesn't expect humans to be entirely cut out of programming. He thinks AI tools will allow smaller teams to tackle larger-scale projects. He's been programming for 41 years.

articles.title: Microsoft CTO breaks down how he sees software developer jobs evolving in the next 5 years
articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott expects the next half-decade to see more AI-generated code than ever. He's been programming for 41 years. Scott believes AI is capable of lowering the barrier of entry to coding, but it'll still be necessary to employ programmers with solid understandings of niche problems.

articles.title: Nasdaq Correction: 3 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks That Are Now Too Cheap to Ignore
articles.author: Adam Levy
articles.summary: The Nasdaq composite index fell into correction territory in March and is still 13.5% below its all-time high as of April 2. Long-term investors should look for AI stocks with good growth potential heading into 2025. Here are three stocks to put on your shortlist: Google, Adobe and Alphabet.

articles.title: What AI anime memes tell us about the future of art and humanity
articles.author: Nilay Patel
articles.summary: On this episode of Decoder, Brian Merchant and I discuss AI and the Studio Ghibli meme trend. We also discuss the current AI art debate and its relationship with copyright laws. We don't agree on all the answers, but the conversation helped Brian consider more clearly how to think about AI and art.

articles.title: AI could impact 40 percent of jobs worldwide: UN
articles.author: Sierra County Sentinel
articles.summary: The global artificial intelligence market is projected to reach $4.8 trillion by 2033. UN warns nearly half of all jobs could be affected by the development of artificial intelligence technology.    i.e. roughly the size of Germany's economy.

articles.title: Hiring managers value AI proficiency but struggle with candidate authenticity
articles.author: Marq Burnett
articles.summary: Hiring managers are looking for candidates with AI-related skills to fill job openings. Generation Z hiring managers ranked AI proficiency as their top hiring factor. AI-driven hiring tools help recruiters and hiring managers vet applicants faster, but they still need to spend time making sure candidates are as qualified as their applications make them appear.

articles.title: AI proficiency tops Gen Z hiring managers' priority list
articles.summary: Hiring managers are looking for candidates with AI-related skills to fill job openings. Resume Genius survey found that 81% of hiring managers prefer candidates with these skills. It also found that AI-driven hiring tools help recruiters and hiring managers vet candidates faster, but they still need to make sure they are as qualified as their applications make them appear.

articles.title: Temenos survey finds three quarters of banks are exploring GenAI deployment
articles.author: Temenos
articles.summary: Temenos, a global leader in banking technology, shared insights from a worldwide survey conducted by Hanover Research. The survey gathered perspectives from 420 business and technology leaders in financial services on the transformative impact of Generative AI (GenAI) in banking. Banks are considering using GenAI to improve customer experience and drive business growth.

articles.title: New Chinese AI Model Beats OpenAI, Google and Microsoft by a Mile With 214x Cheaper Pricing, 100% Faster and 14.8 Trillion Training Tokens
articles.author: Caleb Naysmith
articles.summary: Chinese firm DeepSeek has released a new AI model that outperforms its U.S. counterparts across key metrics such as benchmark scores, training scale, speed, and cost. V3 was trained on approximately 14.8 trillion tokens, which is 6-12x larger than the 1-2 trillion tokens estimated for GPT-4 Turbo.

articles.title: Phonic Launches End-to-End Speech-to-Speech Platform for Building Reliable Voice Agents, Announces $4M Funding Raise
articles.author: Phonic
articles.summary: Phonic announced a $4M funding raise from Lux Capital, Amjad Masad, Clem Delangue, Qasar Younis, Erik Bernhardsson and the founders of Replit, Hugging Face, Applied Intuition and Modal.

articles.title: OpenAI, Anthropic target college students with latest education AI announcements
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: Anthropic launched Claude for Education on Wednesday and OpenAI announced ChatGPT Plus for U.S. and Canadian college students through May. Anthropic secured university-wide access agreements with Northeastern University, Champlain College, and the London School of Economics and Political Science. The Northeastern partnership will provide Claude access to 50,000 students across 13 global campuses.

articles.title: OpenAI, Anthropic target college students with latest education AI announcements
articles.author: Hayden Field
articles.summary: Anthropic launched Claude for Education on Wednesday and OpenAI made ChatGPT Plus free for college students in the U.S. and Canada through May. Both companies are trying to capture the education market through partnerships with universities and convert students into users before they graduate and enter the workforce.

articles.title: The Role of AI in Six Sigma: Enhancing Data Analysis and Process Improvement
articles.author: Liam Frady
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence in Six Sigma offers new opportunities for analysis, process improvement, and additional benefits. The last five years have seen marked improvements in AI, with models like ChatGPT, Gemini, and others making a big splash in the business world. Data analysis is one of the most obvious areas where AI is a net benefit for Six Sigma.

articles.title: How I Realized AI Was Making Me Stupid—and What I Do Now
articles.author: Sam Schechner
articles.summary: ChatGPT, a chatbot developed by Google, has been used by a reporter living in Paris to help her with writing an email about her son's basketball coach. Robert Sternberg, a professor of psychology, argues that AI has already taken a toll on both creativity and intelligence. articles.title: Being Human With AI Launches Beta Version of Hybrid Curriculum for Students in Grades 5–6
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Being Human With AI launches beta version of a free, six- module curriculum for students in grades 5 and 6. The new hybrid program combines teacher-led discussions with an interactive learning mode. It aims to prepare young people for ethical and responsible AI use.

articles.title: Chinese scientists use AI model in colorectal cancer treatment
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Chinese researchers used artificial intelligence to reduce unnecessary surgical resection in colorectal cancer patients after local excision. The team developed and developed the technology at South China University of Technology (SCUT) in Guangdong Province, south China, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Revolutionary Voice AI Platform Phonic Lands $4M Funding from Lux
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Phonic is an AI-powered voice-assistant that can narrate audiobooks, host podcasts, and handle customer support without a hitch. Businesses are waiting for reliable AI voice technology to replace human ones, but Phonic is a step closer to that.

articles.title: AI could impact 40 per cent of jobs worldwide, says UN
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: The global artificial intelligence market is projected to reach $4.8 trillion by 2033. UN warns nearly half of all jobs could be affected by the development of AI. AI is transforming economies and creating vast opportunities, but it also raises concerns about automation and job displacement.
